channel.title: Comments on: Rails 3 with RVM FTW!
channel.description: Plataformatec's place to talk about Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Elixir, and software engineering

item.title: By: Andrew Brown
item.dc:creator: Andrew Brown
item.description: I'm really enjoying RVM, how we lived without it before. I have no idea.
item.content:encoded: I’m really enjoying RVM, how we lived without it before. I have no idea.

item.title: By: Marcin Kulik
item.dc:creator: Marcin Kulik
item.content:encoded:
@Jose,

I’ve just created two fresh apps, one on sqlite, second on mysql. I’ve generated scaffold, migrated and run webrick. Then I’ve been adding, editing, removing posts and everything was working fine.
Check out this gist for steps I’ve taken: http://gist.github.com/384972

I’m using ArchLinux (32-bit) and rvm.

item.title: By: Marcin Kulik
item.dc:creator: Marcin Kulik
item.content:encoded:
@Jose,

I’ve just created two fresh apps, one on sqlite, second on mysql. I’ve generated scaffold, migrated and run webrick. Then I’ve been adding, editing, removing posts and everything was working fine.
Check out this gist for steps I’ve taken: http://gist.github.com/384972

I’m using ArchLinux (32-bit) and rvm.
